heading: 1.2 Inferential or hypothesis testing “Are things different”
text: hypothesis, description. Description can highlight, doesn’t test ’s different. Descriptions can still bias (mean vs median vs range show different things descriptively, PCA problems). Doesn’t mean ’s experiment.
code:
summary(cars)##      speed           dist       
##  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00  
##  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00  
##  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00  
##  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98  
##  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00  
##  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

heading: 3.5 When to use either?
text:
seems like objections bootstrapping linear models (presumably complex models) fall two categories: 1. Sampling design isn’t accounted complete randomization (ignoring stratification categories sampling vagaries) 2. ’s less elegant (???).Venables Ripley 2002, pg 164, say “see bootstrapping little place least-squares regression. errors close normal, standard theory suffices. , better methods fitting least squares, perhaps data transformed […]” Hastie et al. 2008 (Elements Statistical Learning) seem favor bootstrappingJohnston Faulkner (2021) enthusiastically favor bootstrap least relatively simple design replace t-test.
- https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC8613103/#CR47 – says stuff like deal random effects autocorrelation first. done already.Example: run Redundancy Analysis (RDA) la https://r.qcbs.ca/workshop10/book-en/redundancy-analysis.html , understand multivariate normality assumptions. small sample size (around 35 believe) residuals coming normal smaller linear models.
- https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/10.1177/0049124189018002003
- https://statisticsbyjim.com/hypothesis-testing/bootstrapping/
